contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=March 2008}} The '''''quinquennat''''' is literally the five-year term served by each [[President of the French Republic|President of France]]. It was introduced following the [[French constitutional referendum, 2000|French constitutional referendum]] in 2000, when the previous seven-year term was replaced. The idea was first floated by [[Georges Pompidou]] in 1973. ==See also== *[[Sexenio]] *[[French constitutional referendum, 2000]] [[Category:Politics of France]] {{France-poli-stub}}
